intro: Ipomoea assumptae, commonly known as the skyflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet, often with a distinctive purple throat. Its leaves are heart-shaped and velvety to the touch, while its stems are hairy and tend to trail or climb. Ipomoea assumptae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
